the **circle leaf water bottle holder** is a practical and fun project that’s as stylish as it is functional! featuring the beautifully textured [circle leaf crochet stitch][1], this handy holder adds a touch of charm to your everyday essentials. it’s perfect for keeping your water bottle close at hand—whether you’re out for a walk, running errands, or heading to a festival or market. 

with its eye-catching design and easy-to-carry strap, this project is a great way to showcase your crochet skills while creating something you’ll use again and again.

[a video tutorial is included with the pattern.][2]

crochet hook: 
[g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

notions:
[removable stitch markers][4]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5]
[scissors][6]

yarn:
[willow yarns farmhouse cotton][7]
100% cotton; 306yds/100g

yardage:
115 (125) yds

yarn substitutions:
[lion brand made with love][8]
60% cotton, 40% acrylic, 185yds/100g

[wecrochet shine][9]
60% pima cotton, 40% modal, 75yds/50g

[wecrochet dishie][10]
100% cotton, 190yds/100g

[lily sugar ’n cream yarn][11]
100% cotton, 120yds/71g

abbreviations:
ch - chain
hdc - half double crochet
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
[stsc - stacked single crochet][12]
st cluster - stacked cluster 
yo - yarn over

gauge:
17 sts and 12 rows = 4” x 4”. unblocked

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][13]

sizes:
two sizes - small and large.
circumference: 7.85 (9.6)"
diameter: 2.5 (3)"
height: 8 (9.69)"

skill level:
advanced beginner
